DOC.brief_title: Pulmonary MR Angiography Lower Extremity MR Venous Imaging Using Gadofosveset ( Ablavar )
DOC.detailed_description: Specific Aim 1 : To assess first-pass SNR CNR pulmonary MR angiography perform 0.03 mmol/Kg intravenous gadofosveset trisodium . Hypothesis : Use 0.03 mmol/Kg gadofosveset trisodium gradient recall echo pulmonary MR angiography provide pulmonary artery SNR CNR equal well SNR CNR obtain use MR technique 0.2 mmol/Kg conventional contrast agent ( gadopentetate dimeglumine ) equal good 0.1 mmol/Kg intravenous gadobenate dimeglumine . Data compare SNR CNR pulmonary MR angiogram image obtain Washington University part PIOPED III study . Specific Aim 2 : To assess SNR CNR breath-hold pulmonary MR imaging obtain immediately original first-pass breath-hold pulmonary MR angiography . Hypothesis : SNR CNR pulmonary MR angiography perform immediately first-pass breath-hold pulmonary MR angiography least equal SNR CNR obtain use MR technique 0.2 mmol/Kg conventional contrast agent ( gadopentetate dimeglumine ) least equal 0.1 mmol/Kg intravenous gadobenate dimeglumine . Specific Aim 3 : To assess SNR CNR low extremity MR venogram ( MRV ) perform immediately two pulmonary MR angiogram , describe . Hypothesis : SNR CNR passive low extremity MRV perform pulmonary MR angiography equal good SNR CNR obtain use passive MRV technique 0.2 mmol/Kg conventional contrast agent 0.1 mmol/Kg gadobenate dimeglumine . Again , data compare SNR CNR low extremity
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patient pulmonary embolism . 2 . 18 yrs age old 1. allergy gadolinium base contrast . 2. allergy iodated base contrast . 3. renal insufficiency ( GFR < 60 mL/min ? 1.73m2 ) 4. pregnant nursing 5. contraindication MRI
